attributes.action: Allow the use of parliamentary and royal recorded footage for satire in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a country with a great history of comedy and satire, but we hamper the creation of topical satire on television with outdated and over-sensitive laws forbidding the use of footage from parliament or royal events for satire (audio or video is allowed, but not both).

This is ludicrous, especially since the footage can be used for satire in other countries. Do we really believe that British institutions like these are so weak they will be damaged by comedy?

Please could parliament take the time to reconsider this law and give some of our talented comedians the same freedoms other countries have.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the House
